# Open Source Development: Course Resources

This page contains additional resources, references, and tools to support your learning journey in open source development.

## Essential Reading

### Books
- [Producing Open Source Software](https://producingoss.com/) by Karl Fogel
- [The Cathedral and the Bazaar](http://www.catb.org/~esr/writings/cathedral-bazaar/) by Eric Raymond
- [Working in Public: The Making and Maintenance of Open Source Software](https://www.amazon.com/Working-Public-Making-Maintenance-Software/dp/0578675862) by Nadia Eghbal
- [Open Source for the Enterprise](https://www.oreilly.com/library/view/open-source-for/0596101198/) by Dan Woods and Gautam Guliani

### Articles and Papers
- [The Open Source Definition](https://opensource.org/osd)
- [How to Contribute to Open Source](https://opensource.guide/how-to-contribute/)
- [A Business Guide to Open Source](https://www.linuxfoundation.org/resources/open-source-guides/a-business-guide-to-open-source)
- [The Economic Value of Open Source Software](https://www.linuxfoundation.org/blog/blog/the-economic-value-of-open-source-software)

## Online Courses and Tutorials

- [GitHub Learning Lab](https://lab.github.com/)
- [Open Source Society University](https://github.com/ossu/computer-science)
- [How to Contribute to an Open Source Project on GitHub](https://egghead.io/courses/how-to-contribute-to-an-open-source-project-on-github)
- [Introduction to Git and GitHub](https://www.coursera.org/learn/introduction-git-github)
